title: Bryan’s Doom Mash Track – Nick Vacca
content:
Reportage

Bryan’s Doom Mash Track

By: Nick Vacca
February 25, 2021

Since we posted Two Wheel Drive yesterday, we thought it’d be nice to feature one of the shop employee’s personal bikes. Bryan is a mechanic and his Mash track bike is too slick, laced with Albuquerque’s own DOOM bars and some other nice details. Check out our friend Nick’s photos below with words by Bryan himself…

This is my Mash SF track bike. There are many others like it, but this one is mine. I started riding fixed gear thanks to Mark, at the Fixed and Free Custom Bike Shop. I never would have had the push to switch up from my single speed, or build up my first proper fixed gear build without him motivating me.

Fixed gear bikes helped me find and help build a community in Albuquerque that is inclusive, friendly, and fun. Working at a shop now, I get the opportunity to spread that joy and knowledge of what a simple bicycle can do to change your life.

Build spec:
MASH SF Smokey Rainbro- 55cm
Thomson seat post- Elite, 27.2
Phil Wood seat collar
Ritchey WCS Skyline saddle
White Industries headset & spacers
Thomson stem -Elite X4, 0⁰ x 100mm x 31.8
Doom Bars- Custom “Smoked TF Out” Legal Drinker TM/Doom shims
Yoshida Best Champ grips- black sparkle
Crane N-E Bell
Paul track hubs laced to H Plus Son The Hydra rims w/custom rainbow nipple pattern(shout out Mark at Fixed & Free!!)
Terravail Sparwood 700 x 35mm meats
Sugino75 crank & sealed BB
MASH SF/MKS pedals w/ All-City toe clips, Cinelli double strap
AARN 49T B&W Camo, rainbro bolts
EAI Gold Medal Track Cog- 17T
Izumi Super Tough chain
Big Gulp and Nickleless Cage
